PARAGRAPH.STRING: (Lakota: Mato Tipila) is a monolithic igneous intrusion or volcanic neck located in the Black Hills near Hulett and Sundance in Crook County, northeastern Wyoming, above the Belle Fourche River.
rises dramatically 1267 feet (386 m) above the surrounding terrain and the summit is 5112 feet (1558 m) above sea level.
